intro: Crula, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to coastal regions of Europe and North Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is often found in maritime environments, where it tolerates salt spray and strong winds. Its unique appearance makes it a notable species in coastal botany.
